dct_title_s: Novissima et Accuratissima TOTIUS AMERICÆ DESCRIPTIO
dct_description_sm: California as an island with nearly flat northern coast, much like Goos type. Straet Anian and Anian to far north. Partial coastline of Zelandia Nova to far southwest.
Dedicated to D. Cornelio Witsen, whose arms are shown on a shield supported by angels (upper left).
Title is on a stone block with two snakes above and figures of natives on either side. A chief is under an umbrella to right of title. (lower left).
Issued in: Novus atlas absolutissimus , Vol. VI/ J. Jansson, 1658 (actual date is in question).

Issued in: De nieuwe en onbekende weereld / Montanus, 1671. Copy in Dutch edition is by Gerard Schagen. Copy in German edition is by Jacob Meursius, but it has different title piece and vignette. John Ogilby's book, America, 1671, has similar map.
Issued in: Atlas minor sive geographia compendiosa, qua orbis terrarum, per paucas attamen novissimas tabulas ostenditur / Amstelædami, N. Visscher, [1690?].
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
